ul.li1: 281 The wicked flee, but no one pursues,
ul.li2: but the righteous is bold like a lion.
ul.li1: 2By the rebellion of a land, her rulers increase,
ul.li2: but by a person of intelligence who knows justice, it will last.
ul.li1: 3A man who is poor and oppresses the impoverished
ul.li2: is a beating rain that leavesLiterally “and there is” no food.
ul.li1: 4Those who forsake instruction will praise the wicked,
ul.li2: but they who guard instruction will struggle against them.
ul.li1: 5Men of evil do not understand justice,
ul.li2: but seekers of Yahweh understand completely.Or “everything”
ul.li1: 6Better to be poor and walking in one’s integrity
ul.li2: than to be crooked of ways when one is rich.
ul.li1: 7He who keeps instruction is a child of understanding,
ul.li2: but the companion of gluttons will shame his father.
ul.li1: 8He who augments his wealth with interest and with usury
ul.li2: gathers it for him who is kind to the poor.
ul.li1: 9He who turns his ear from listening to instruction,
ul.li2: even his prayer is an abomination.
ul.li1: 10He who misleads the upright onto the way of evil,
ul.li2: into his pits he will fall.
But as for the blameless, they will inherit good.
ul.li1: 11A man of wealth is wise in his own eyes,
ul.li2: but the intelligent poor sees through him.
ul.li1: 12When the righteous triumphs, great is the glory,
ul.li2: but with the rising of the wicked, a person will be hidden.
ul.li1: 13He who conceals his transgression will not prosper,
ul.li2: but he who confesses and forsakes will obtain mercy.
ul.li1: 14Happy is the person who fears continuously,
ul.li2: but he who is stubborn of heart,Or “mind” will fall into calamity.
ul.li1: 15Like a roaring lion and a charging bear
ul.li2: is a wicked ruler over a poor people.
ul.li1: 16A ruler who lacks understanding isHebrew “and” a cruel oppressor,
ul.li2: but those who hate unjust gain will have longOr “prolong” days.
ul.li1: 17A person who is burdened with the blood of another,Literally “life”
ul.li2: until death he will flee;
do not take hold of him.
ul.li1: 18He who walks in integrity will be safe,
ul.li2: but he who takes crooked paths will fall in one.
ul.li1: 19He who tills his ground will have plenty bread,
ul.li2: but he who follows fantasies will have plenty of poverty.
ul.li1: 20A man of faithfulness has abundant blessings,
ul.li2: but he who hurries to become rich will not go unpunished.
ul.li1: 21Showing partialityLiterally “Recognizing faces” is not good,
ul.li2: and over a morsel of bread, a strong man will do wrong.
ul.li1: 22He who hurries for wealth is a man with an evil eye,Literally “a man of evil of eye”
ul.li2: but he does not know that poverty will come upon him.
ul.li1: 23He who rebukes a person will afterward find more favor
ul.li2: than he who flatters with the tongue.
ul.li1: 24He who robs his father and his mother and says, “There is no crime,”
ul.li2: is partner to a man who corrupts.
ul.li1: 25The greedy personLiterally “wide soul” will stir up strife,
ul.li2: but he who trusts in Yahweh will be enriched.
ul.li1: 26He who trusts in his own heartOr “mind,” or “sense” is a fool,
ul.li2: but he who walks in wisdom will be saved.
ul.li1: 27For he who gives to the poor, there is no lacking,
ul.li2: but for heHebrew “those” who turns his eyes, there are many curses.
ul.li1: 28With the rising of the wicked, humankind will be hidden,
ul.li2: and with their perishing, the righteous will multiply.
